data.name: Page1_Label1
data.value: Thank for you downloading Roadkill .NET Wiki engine. The installer writes the settings you enter here to the web.config file (and also the database).

data.name: Page1_Label2
data.value: In order to proceed, first we need to test if you have write access to the web.config file.

data.name: Page1_WebConfig_Success_Message
data.value: The web.config can be written to.

data.name: Page1_WebConfig_Failure_Message
data.value: Unable to write to the web.config file.

data.name: Page2_Label1
data.value: Below are some required settings for Roadkill to work correctly. You can change these later via the settings page as an admin.

data.name: Page2_Success
data.value: The database connection is was successful.

data.name: Page2_Group1_Label
data.value: The name of the wiki, which appears on certain themes and in signup emails (if enabled).

data.name: Page2_Group2_Label
data.value: The full url of the wiki, which appears in signup and reset passwords emails (if enabled). Do not include the trailing slash.

data.name: Page2_Group3_Label
data.value: You will need to create the database first if you are using a named instance. Below are a few examples, use the second option is you are using shared hosting without any SQL Server hosting.

data.name: Page3_Label1
data.value: Do you want to users to be authenticated against an Active Directory using Windows authentication?

data.name: Page3_AD_Group1_Label1
data.value: This should be in the format LDAP://mydc01.company.internal (it should be uppercase LDAP) where mydc01 is your domain controller and 'company' and 'internal' are the dns suffixes for your network. This can also be an IP address. You can usually get this information by running "ipconfig".

data.name: Page3_AD_Group1_Label2
data.value: The connection string supports OU specifiers however doing it this way can cause issues. If you are unsure about this setting, it's recommended you download AD Explorer first.

data.name: Page3_AD_Group1_Label3
data.value: Enter a username and password if the user that the app pool is running under does not have read access to Active Directory. This is useful if your domain is a separate forest from the main domain (i.e. another branch office).

data.name: Page3_AD_Group2_Label
data.value: This is the security group that users should belong to in order to be editors (people who can edit and create pages). The test button uses the connection settings entered above.

data.name: Page3_AD_Group3_Label
data.value: This is the security group that users should belong to in order to be admins. Admins have the same rights as editors, but also have access to configuration settings and tools for the site.The test button uses the connection settings entered above.

data.name: Page3_DB_Group1_Label1
data.value: This is the name of the editor role - people who can edit and create pages.

data.name: Page3_DB_Group2_Label1
data.value: This is the name of the admin role. Admins have the same rights as editors, but also have access to configuration settings and tools for the site.

data.name: Page3_DB_Group3_Label1
data.value: Check this option if you want to allow people to signup as a new users. If left unchecked, only admins will be able to create new users.

data.name: Page3_DB_Group4_Label1
data.value: If you are allowing user signups, it's recommended that you also enable Recaptcha support. This is a free anti-spam bot service provided by Google, you will need to signup and copy your public and private key into the fields below. Signup here - you will need to create a google account first.

data.name: Page3_DB_Group5_Label1
data.value: This is the email address for the admin user. You can add more admins in the settings page, so this user does not 'own' the site

data.name: Page3_DB_Group6_Label1
data.value: This is the password for the admin user.

data.name: Page4_Label1
data.value: Almost done...Finally some extra tweakable settings.

data.name: Page4_Group1_Success
data.value: The folder exists and can be written to.

data.name: Page4_Group1_Error
data.value: Unable to write to the folder:

data.name: Page4_Group1_Label1
data.value: This is the directory where all files are uploaded to. This directory will need write permission by the user that the app pool runs under. Most of the time you shouldn't have to worry about changing the permissions for the folder, as they will be inherited from the parent folder.

data.name: Page4_Group1_Label2
data.value: Make sure the folder path begins with "~/" for the website root. You should check the folder can be accessed by the browser as well as the being writeable to, as folders such as App_Data and bin can be written to but will not show any images stored there.

data.name: Page4_Group2_Label1
data.value: These are the file extensions that can be uploaded.

data.name: Page4_Group3_Label1
data.value: This is the markup format that is used. Roadkill currently supports the following values: Creole, Markdown, Mediawiki.

data.name: Page4_Group4_Label1
data.value: This is the markup format that is used. Roadkill currently supports the following values: Creole, Markdown, Mediawiki.

data.name: Page4_Group5_Label1
data.value: Roadkill uses NHibernate caching along with ASP.NET's output caching. It's recommended that you enable caching to increase the responsiveness of the site. Database caching is not currently supported for for web gardens or web farms.

data.name: Page4_Group5_Label2
data.value: This setting only affects database caching, you will need to manually disable output caching in the web.config.

data.name: Page4_Group5_Label5
data.value: Unchecking "Cache text content" will mean each page's textual content is loaded from the database.

data.name: Page5_Error_Title
data.value: An error occurred during the install

data.name: Page5_Error_Label1
data.value: Please go back through the installation steps and check your settings. The error message was
